com: super reaction from Haddin after a peach from Hazlewood, hits the track short of a length, just about holds the line, bang on the line of the stumps too, Bell has to play, and Haddin sticks out a hand as he falls to his right to pouch it

Johnson strikes, via a sharp take from Maxwell, Taylor reaches for the drive at a good length delivery leaving him on the angle, he can't keep it down, Maxwell goes down on his left and stretches to take it low at backward point, they check for the no ball, it is tight, but it is settled in favour of the bowler

and out of nowhere, he comes up with a snorter on target, Moeen can only fend this to wide slip, short ball, climbing steeply on off, Moeen can't avoid that, tries to ride the bounce and survive, fails

Johnson all over England, yet again, captain has left his first ball which has crashed into off stump, good length delivery, holds the line, Morgan makes a late decision to let it go, and pays for it instantly

and he breaks through immediately, it is his day, what a delivery first up, no warm up business, yorker, full and straight, Root misses with the clip, pad is in the way of the stumps, agrees the umpire, that is taking out middle
Maxwell not only hits reverse sweeps, he also gets batsmen on the shot, Pat Cummins the substitute at short third man, throws himself forward to take it low, helps that he is quite tall, of course
how: c sub (PJ Cummins) b Maxwell 17 (20m 22b 3x4 0x6) SR: 77.27

com: and now he is on a hat-trick too, Glenn Maxwell, how soft is this, Woakes has leaned forward and just popped back this offbreak straight to the bowler, horror game for Woakes this, 0 for 89, and now this
but he departs next ball, it is the slog sweep again, this time he has connected, only as far as deep midwicket, another fine take there from substitute Cummins
how: c sub (PJ Cummins) b Maxwell 24 (21m 20b 2x4 2x6) SR: 120.00

com: that is the end of whatever Bopara was doing, skips down the track, isn't to the pitch, and mishits to extra cover, Maxwell has a chance to claim five now
it is Hazlewood who ends the innings with a yorker on middle stump, Finn backs away, and swings in vain
